intro: Anaphalis cutchica, commonly known as the wooly fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its dense, white, woolly foliage and small, yellow-centered composite flowers. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and meadows. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Anaphalis cutchica is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
